page.title: 07Housing. Barbridge.
page.content: No land is available for housing development unless necessary for agricultural purposes.Nine farms are family farms,seven form part of country estates.Cheshire C.C.own two smallholdings.Parts of some farmhouses date back to the 17th century often having been altered by landowners who added their particular style of architecture.There are two gentleman's residences,one privately owned and one converted into flats.One Tied Cottage housing a farm worker exists at Hurleston,most having been sold or let.Smallholdings,no longer being an economic proposition,many have been purchased by commuters who have added modern amenities whilst retaining the character of the original buildings. There are 6 pre-war Council houses at Stoke and 4 houses for employees at Hurleston Water Treatment Works.
